issue.title: GOOGLE MOBİLE ADS NAMESPACE
issue.body:
<!-- DO NOT DELETE
validate_template=true
template_path=.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/bug_report.md
-->
### Step 0: Are you in the right place?

  * For general technical questions, or help with project-specific issues like setting up ads in
   your app, reach out to our support team on the
   [Developer Forum](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!categories/google-admob-ads-sdk/game-engines).
  * For assistance with your AdMob account, reach out to
   [AdMob Support](https://support.google.com/admob/?hl=en#topic=7383088).
  * For feedback on [our documentation](https://developers.google.com/admob/unity/start),
   send  your feedback by pressing the **Send Feedback** button at the top right of the
    documentation page you are on.
  * For issues related to __the code in this repository__, continue filing this GitHub issue.

  * Once you've read this section and determined that your issue is appropriate for
    this repository, **please delete this section**.

### [REQUIRED] Step 1: Describe your environment

  * Unity version: 2022.3.6
  * Google Mobile Ads Unity plugin version: 8.5.2
  * Platform: _____ (iOS, Android, Unity Editor)
  * Platform OS version: _____ (eg iOS 10, Android 9)
  * Any specific devices issue occurs on: _____
  * Mediation ad networks used, and their versions: _____



### [REQUIRED] Step 2: Describe the problem

#### Steps to reproduce:

GUYS, I AM WORKING ON A PROJECT FOR 2 MONTHS. EVERYTHING WAS WORKING UNTIL I PUBLISH THE PROJECT ON PLAY STORE. AFTER PUBLISHING, FIRST GOOGLE LOGIN SYSTEM STOPPED WORKING. I TRIED EVERYTHING TO MAKE IT WORK AGAIN BUT WHEN I CHANGED THE JSON FILE, THE ADS ALSO STOPPED WORKING, GOOGLE MOBILEADS FOLDER HAS GONE, I CAN NOT IMPORT IT AGAIN, UNITY DOES NOT RECOGNIZE MOBILE ADS NAMESPACE AND NOW I AM DONE.

I AM REALLY TIRED OF DEALING WITH YOUR F*CKING PACKAGES' F*CKING PROBLEMS. WHY NONE OF YOUR PACKAGES WORKS AS THEY HAS TO BE? WHY ALL OF YOUR PACKAGES ARE FULL OF MISTAKES, PROBLEMS, BUGS OR EVRY OTHER F*CKING THINGS? ARE YOU ENJOYING TO WASTE OUR TIME? OR ARE YOU ENJOYINNG TO MAKE US FREAKED OUT LIKE THAT? WHY ARE YOU DOINNG THIS? ALL YOU NEED TO DO IS JUST CREATING ONE SIMPLE NICE WORKING PACKAGE BUT THE "BIIIIG" GOOGLE CAN NOT DO THAT, HUH? ENOUGH, ENOUGH, ENOUGH.

I HOPED TO BUILD THIS PROJECT AND SEND IT TO MY CLIENT SUCCESSFULLY AND PAY MY BILLS IN TIME. BUT THANKS TO YOUR ST*PID BRAINS, THE PROJECT THAT FINELY WORKS IS A MESS NOW.

WHAT WERE YOU THINKING? WILL THIS F*CKING SECOND SHA KEY OR PLAY INTEGRITY THINGS SERVE US EXTRA SECURITY? NO IT WONT. YOU ARE JUST SCTRACTHING YOUR OBESE A*SES, DECIDING THE STUPIDEST THINGS AND SH*TTING TO ALL OF OURS PROJECTS.

```

```

issue.title: Crashes caused by the ads plugin
issue.body:
We are having a lot of crashes reported on Firebase Crashlytics and on Android Vitals. As it is not reproducible on our test environment, it took us several weeks to finally find out what was causing all these errors.

When we removed and stopped using the Google Mobile Ads plugin, absolutely all the crashes were gone. To be sure, we added it again and just a few minutes after the update was live the crashes started to happen again.

There are a few different stack traces causing the crashes:

**CRASH 1**
```
il2cpp::vm::Method::GetParamCount(MethodInfo const*)
scripting_method_invoke(ScriptingMethodPtr, ScriptingObjectPtr, ScriptingArguments&, ScriptingExceptionPtr*, bool)
ScriptingInvocation::Invoke(ScriptingExceptionPtr*, bool)
UnityJavaProxy_invoke(_JNIEnv*, _jobject*, long long, _jstring*, _jobjectArray*)
```

**CRASH 2**
```
std::_Rb_tree_insert_and_rebalance(bool, std::_Rb_tree_node_base*, std::_Rb_tree_node_base*, std::_Rb_tree_node_base&)
std::_Rb_tree_iterator<DelayedCallManager::Callback> std::_Rb_tree<DelayedCallManager::Callback, DelayedCallManager::Callback, std::_Identity<DelayedCallManager::Callback>, std::less<DelayedCallManager::Callback>, memory_pool<DelayedCallManager::Callback> >::_M_insert_<DelayedCallManager::Callback const&>(std::_Rb_tree_node_base*, std::_Rb_tree_node_base*, DelayedCallManager::Callback const&)
CallDelayed(CallObjectState (*)(Object*, void*), PPtr<Object>, float, void*, float, CallObjectState (*)(void*), DelayedCallManager::DelayedCallMode)
Coroutine::HandleIEnumerableCurrentReturnValue(ScriptingObjectPtr)
Coroutine::ProcessCoroutineCurrent()
Coroutine::Run(bool*)
MonoBehaviour::TryCreateAndRunCoroutine(ScriptingObjectPtr, ScriptingMethodPtr, Coroutine**)
MonoBehaviour::StartCoroutineManaged2(ScriptingObjectPtr)
MonoBehaviour_CUSTOM_StartCoroutineManaged2(ScriptingBackendNativeObjectPtrOpaque*, ScriptingBackendNativeObjectPtrOpaque*)
EventHandler_1_Invoke_mBF3979EE17B68658C4C1AB3A8D64B24F263E3B98_gshared
EventHandler_1_Invoke_mBF3979EE17B68658C4C1AB3A8D64B24F263E3B98_gshared
RuntimeInvoker_TrueVoid_t22962CB4C05B1D89B55A6E1139F0E87A90987017_RuntimeObject(void (*)(), MethodInfo const*, void*, void**)
il2cpp::vm::Runtime::Invoke(MethodInfo const*, void*, void**, Il2CppException**)
```

**CRASH 3**
```
std::_Rb_tree_rebalance_for_erase(std::_Rb_tree_node_base*, std::_Rb_tree_node_base&)
std::_Rb_tree<DelayedCallManager::Callback, DelayedCallManager::Callback, std::_Identity<DelayedCallManager::Callback>, std::less<DelayedCallManager::Callback>, memory_pool<DelayedCallManager::Callback> >::erase[abi:cxx11](std::_Rb_tree_const_iterator<DelayedCallManager::Callback>)
DelayedCallManager::Update(int)
ExecutePlayerLoop(NativePlayerLoopSystem*)
ExecutePlayerLoop(NativePlayerLoopSystem*)
PlayerLoop()
UnityPlayerLoop()
nativeRender(_JNIEnv*, _jobject*)
```

comment.body:
@dendyak as we can see the answer for this question: https://groups.google.com/g/google-admob-ads-sdk/c/8dHd4eFb43I
MobileAds.RaiseAdEventsOnUnityMainThread equals to the MobileAdsEventExecutor in every callback.
However I tested variant with only MobileAdsEventExecutor in every callback, tested variant with MobileAds.RaiseAdEventsOnUnityMainThread and tested both in the code. 
The issues still present.

issue.title: (UMP) ConsentInformation.Update(request, OnConsentInfoUpdated) isnt working correctly if you call it a second time.
issue.body:
<!-- DO NOT DELETE
validate_template=true
template_path=.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/bug_report.md
-->

### [REQUIRED] Step 1: Describe your environment

  * Unity version: 2021.1.38f1
  * Google Mobile Ads Unity plugin version: v8.5.2
  * Platform:Android
  * Platform OS version: non-specific
  * Any specific devices issue occurs on: Poco F5
  * Mediation ad networks used, and their versions: None



### [REQUIRED] Step 2: Describe the problem

#### Steps to reproduce:

Context: im trying to show an age gate. asking users for their age ONLY IF consentStatus is Required then setting the value of  request.TagForUnderAgeOfConsent  to true/false depending on the input from the age screen.

Expected result: if is TagForUnderAgeOfConsent is set to true on the second  ConsentInformation.Update the UMP Consent form should not be allowed to be displayed to user.

Actual result: Its still showing the consent form even if up call  ConsentInformation.Update a second time with an updated request parameters like TagForUnderAgeOfConsent = true

NOTE: THIS ONLY HAPPENS WHEN TESTED ON REAL DEVICE. IT WORKS FINE IN UNITY EDITOR. THE CONSENT FORM DOESNT SHOW IF AGE IS BELOW AGE ON THE EDITOR

I tried hardcoding a new request parameter with TagForUnderAgeOfConsent = true on the second ConsentInformation.Update call but the consent is still appearing.

I tried debug log the request.TagForUnderAgeOfConsent  before calling the second ConsentInformation.Update() and can confirm that TagForUnderAgeOfConsent   is true but the consent still shows afterwards

#### Relevant Code:

public class GDPRConsentManager : MonoBehaviour
{
    private ConsentRequestParameters request;

    // Start is called before the first frame update
    void Start()
    {
        var debugSettings = new ConsentDebugSettings
        {
            // Geography appears as in EEA for debug devices.
            DebugGeography = DebugGeography.EEA,
            TestDeviceHashedIds = new List<string>
        {}};

        // Set tag for under age of consent.
        // Here false means users are not under age of consent.
        request = new ConsentRequestParameters
        {
            TagForUnderAgeOfConsent = false,
            ConsentDebugSettings = debugSettings,
        };

        // Check the current consent information status.
        ConsentInformation.Update(request, OnConsentInfoUpdated);
    }
    void OnConsentInfoUpdated(FormError consentError)
    {
        if (consentError != null)
        {
            // Handle the error.
            UnityEngine.Debug.LogError(consentError);
            return;
        }

        if (ConsentInformation.ConsentStatus == ConsentStatus.Required)
        {
            ShowAgeScreen(ProceedWithConsent);
        }
        else
        {
            LoadAndShowConsentForm();
        }
    }

    private void ProceedWithConsent()
    {
        // This callback is called after the age screen is completed by the user
        ConsentInformation.Update(request, (updateError) => // ive debugged it request.TagForUnderAgeOfConsent  is true and even if i pass a new instantiated request with TagForUnderAgeOfConsent to true the consent form still appear when it shouldnt
        {
            if (updateError != null)
            {
                // Handle the error.
                UnityEngine.Debug.LogError(updateError);
                return;
            }
            LoadAndShowConsentForm();


            Debug.Log("TagForUnderAgeOfConsent: " + request.TagForUnderAgeOfConsent);
        });
    }

    void ShowAgeScreen(Action callback)
    {
        // Display the age screen
        UIManager.Instance.AgeScreenPanel.SetActive(true);

        Button confirmButton = UIManager.Instance.AgeScreenPanel.GetComponentInChildren<Button>();

        // Remove any previous listeners attached to the button
        confirmButton.onClick.RemoveAllListeners();

        confirmButton.onClick.AddListener(() =>
        {
            // Retrieve birth year from InputField and determine age
            var isUnderAgeOfConsent = (int)UIManager.Instance.AgeSlider.value < 16;
            request.TagForUnderAgeOfConsent = isUnderAgeOfConsent;

            // Hide the age screen
            UIManager.Instance.AgeScreenPanel.SetActive(false);

            // Call the provided callback
            callback.Invoke();
        });
    }

    private static void LoadAndShowConsentForm()
    {
        // If the error is null, the consent information state was updated.
        // You are now ready to check if a form is available.
        ConsentForm.LoadAndShowConsentFormIfRequired((FormError formError) =>
        {
            if (formError != null)
            {
                // Consent gathering failed.
                UnityEngine.Debug.LogError(formError);
                return;
            }

            // Consent has been gathered.
            if (ConsentInformation.CanRequestAds())
            {
                AdsManager.Instance.InitializeSDK();
            }
        });
    }
}

pull_request.title: Removed statically cached reference to consent request params while generating java object on Android.
pull_request.body:
Removed statically cached reference to consent request params while generating java object on Android.
Fixed #2974 - ConsentInformation.Update(request, OnConsentInfoUpdated) isn't working correctly if you call it a second time.

issue.title: Unity 3.8.0 - Resolution failed
issue.body:
<!-- DO NOT DELETE
validate_template=true
template_path=.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/bug_report.md
-->
### [REQUIRED] Step 1: Describe your environment

  * Unity version: 2021.3.30f1
  * Google Mobile Ads Unity plugin version: 8.5.2
  * Platform: Android - Unity Editor
  * Mediation ad networks used, and their versions: Applovin 6.8.0, Liftoff 4.0.0, Meta 3.10.0, Mintegral 1.2.1, Pangle 2.3.0 and Unity 3.8.0


### [REQUIRED] Step 2: Describe the problem

#### Steps to reproduce:
Just add all the packages without unity 3.8.0 and force resolve. Everything will be fine.
Add Unity 3.8.0 and force resolve again. You will get the following error:
Resolution failed

Failed to fetch the following dependencies:
org.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-bom:1.8.10

Initially I also had Firebase analytics 11.4.0 and Crashlytics 11.4.0 but I started a new project to test just the mediations. 
Is there a short fix for this? 
Thank you!

comment.body:
> @dcosmin-97
> 
>     * Was there any change in behaviour?
> 
>     * You can also try using Unity 2022.3 or greater
> 
> 
> @cyrusamirabadi
> 
>     * This sounds like a different issue. Were there any prebuild errors. If you can double check the `External Dependency Manager > Android Resolver > Force Resolve` command, that could be reporting issues.

Try with the following setup:
Unity 2022.3.11f1
Admob 8.5.2
Firebase Analytics & Crashlytics 11.6.0
Applovin 6.9.1
Liftoff 4.0.0
Meta 3.11.0
Mintegral 1.2.1
Pangle 2.3.0
Admob setup with com.google.android.gms:play-services-ads:[22.3.0]

Everything is working fine with the above setup.
If you add Unity 3.8.0 and force resolve, you will get the error:
Resolution failed
Failed to fetch the following dependencies:
org.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-bom:1.8.10

I have tried other things as well, but no results. Any other ideas?
Thank you!

When we removed and stopped using the Google Mobile Ads plugin, absolutely all the crashes were gone. To be sure, we added it again and just a few minutes after the update was live the crashes started to happen again.

issue.title: External Dependency Manager fails to resolve the MetaAudienceNetwork dependencies.
issue.body:
<!-- DO NOT DELETE
validate_template=true
template_path=.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/bug_report.md
-->
  * Unity version: 2022.3.10f1
  * Google Mobile Ads Unity plugin version: v8.5.2
  * Platform: UnityEditor Android build
  * Mediation ad networks used, and their versions: IronSource-2.3.1, UnityAds-3.8.0, AppLovin-6.9.1, MetaAudienceNetwork-3.11.0

Apparently when I add MetaAudienceNetwork-3.11.0 adapter External Dependency Manager fails to resolve.
Here is the console error message:
```
Resolution failed
Failed to fetch the following dependencies:
org.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-bom:1.8.10
```

#### Steps to reproduce:
Download the demo project
[https://drive.google.com/file/d/1raDeZt11w3lO7tl8L-OHIi1TWwYlfoUq](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1raDeZt11w3lO7tl8L-OHIi1TWwYlfoUq)
Try to resolve the dependencies:
Assets > External Dependency Resolver > Android Resolver > Force Resolve

comment.body:
> We are looking into a better fix.

Thanks a lot, will the release process be improved ? Each time I upgrade there are issues, that'd be good if the adapters where tested too

issue.title: AdMob banner ads not showing after app pause/resume
issue.body:
<!-- DO NOT DELETE
validate_template=true
template_path=.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/bug_report.md
-->
### [REQUIRED] Step 1: Describe your environment

  * Unity version: 2022.3.10f1
  * Google Mobile Ads Unity plugin version: 8.5.2
  * Platform: Android
  * Platform OS version: Android 13
  * Any specific devices issue occurs on: All Android devices tested
  * Mediation ad networks used, and their versions: Only Admob

### [REQUIRED] Step 2: Describe the problem

Banner ads show correctly at app start, and as long as the app stays in focus. If users switch to a different app, or the phone locks, on app resume the banner ads are no longer visible. This only happens on Android, the same app on iOS works fine. It happens in both development and release builds.

@NVentimiglia , I see your workaround [here](https://github.com/googleads/googleads-mobile-unity/issues/1342#issuecomment-1433924368), but I am not sure how to implement it. I tried creating a Unity plugin following https://docs.unity3d.com/Manual/android-custom-activity.html, but could not get it to work.

Is the workaround still valid?
Can you provide instructions?
Is this bug being addressed?

[ FYI, I have also posted this issue as a [comment](https://github.com/googleads/googleads-mobile-unity/issues/1342#issuecomment-1752089134) to the previous (closed) thread ]

#### Steps to reproduce:

Happy to provide logs or other info, just not sure what would help.
Are others seeing this behavior?

#### Relevant Code:

comment.body:
Ok. I got the same behaviour with the example in this repo.
You will find 
- the test project, 
- the exported android studio project, 
- an apk and 
- a screen recording 
of what happens in this link: https://we.tl/t-JehKUBAK0U

The screen recording is from a Pixel 6a, Android 13.
I have also tested it on a Xiaomi Mi Note 10 Lite, Android 12, with the same results.

The reproduction plan is simple.
1. Launch the app.
2. Load a banner ad and wait for it to appear.
3. Hit the home button for the app to go to the background.
4. Open the app again from the task manager or the icon on the desktop.
5. The ad will disappear as soon as you enter the app. (hitting the hide and show buttons doesn't resolve the situation)

The project is using 
Unity 2022.3.11f1
Admob SDK 8.5.2
IL2CPP scripting backend,
Minimum API 22,
Target API 33
and is built with Android Studio Giraffe | 2022.3.1 Patch 2
on an Macbook Pro with M2 Pro, Mac OS 13.5

issue.title: Adaptive Banner cause severe performance issue when it's an animated banner
issue.body:
<!-- DO NOT DELETE
validate_template=true
template_path=.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/bug_report.md
-->

### [REQUIRED] Step 1: Describe your environment

  * Unity version: 2021.3.14
  * Google Mobile Ads Unity plugin version: 8.5.2
  * Platform: Android
  * Platform OS version: Android 11
  * Any specific devices issue occurs on: Redmi 9T
  * Mediation ad networks used, and their versions: admob only



### [REQUIRED] Step 2: Describe the problem

#### Steps to reproduce:

Reproduce project:
https://github.com/jacattrongnlh/AdmobAdaptiveBanner

Steps:
- Build the APK from the repo. (or download the build from Releases tab)
- Run it on a device.
- Wait a few seconds for Admob initialization.
- Tap on the button "Adaptive Banner" to load an adaptive banner.
- Drag and hold the Scroll View.
- Tap on the button "Default Banner" to load the default size banner.
- Drag and hold the Scroll View.

Comparing the framerate of the Scroll View before and after loading the adaptive banner, you can see that the Scroll View was smooth and responsive before the banner was shown. After the banner is shown, the Scroll View becomes very laggy when you drag it.

The framerate of the game is unaffected, it's the rate of UI's responsiveness that is affected.

Attaching Android Studio to profile the performance, you can see the CPU usage is significantly high when the animated Adaptive banner is displayed. When a static default banner is displayed, the CPU usage is not as high.

Profiler Screenshot: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1PMpr7BfkEkYLCFPDUJGb1MixbHUlKFqB/view?usp=sharing

Video recorded showing the problem: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KX3ht2Exx9SYfDN7ZUpx6cf0zXaX986Q/view?usp=drive_link

issue.title: AdMob banner ads not showing after app pause/resume
issue.body:
<!-- DO NOT DELETE
validate_template=true
template_path=.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/bug_report.md
-->
### [REQUIRED] Step 1: Describe your environment

  * Unity version: 2022.3.10f1
  * Google Mobile Ads Unity plugin version: 8.5.2
  * Platform: Android
  * Platform OS version: Android 13
  * Any specific devices issue occurs on: All Android devices tested
  * Mediation ad networks used, and their versions: Only Admob

### [REQUIRED] Step 2: Describe the problem

Banner ads show correctly at app start, and as long as the app stays in focus. If users switch to a different app, or the phone locks, on app resume the banner ads are no longer visible. This only happens on Android, the same app on iOS works fine. It happens in both development and release builds.

@NVentimiglia , I see your workaround [here](https://github.com/googleads/googleads-mobile-unity/issues/1342#issuecomment-1433924368), but I am not sure how to implement it. I tried creating a Unity plugin following https://docs.unity3d.com/Manual/android-custom-activity.html, but could not get it to work.

Is the workaround still valid?
Can you provide instructions?
Is this bug being addressed?

[ FYI, I have also posted this issue as a [comment](https://github.com/googleads/googleads-mobile-unity/issues/1342#issuecomment-1752089134) to the previous (closed) thread ]

#### Steps to reproduce:

Happy to provide logs or other info, just not sure what would help.
Are others seeing this behavior?

#### Relevant Code:

comment.body: @NVentimiglia, I'll see if I can reproduce it in a simple test project and I'll let you know. Unfortunately, I can't share company code.

MobileAds.RaiseAdEventsOnUnityMainThread = true;

issue.title: Unity 3.8.0 - Resolution failed
issue.body:
<!-- DO NOT DELETE
validate_template=true
template_path=.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/bug_report.md
-->
### [REQUIRED] Step 1: Describe your environment

  * Unity version: 2021.3.30f1
  * Google Mobile Ads Unity plugin version: 8.5.2
  * Platform: Android - Unity Editor
  * Mediation ad networks used, and their versions: Applovin 6.8.0, Liftoff 4.0.0, Meta 3.10.0, Mintegral 1.2.1, Pangle 2.3.0 and Unity 3.8.0


### [REQUIRED] Step 2: Describe the problem

#### Steps to reproduce:
Just add all the packages without unity 3.8.0 and force resolve. Everything will be fine.
Add Unity 3.8.0 and force resolve again. You will get the following error:
Resolution failed

Failed to fetch the following dependencies:
org.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-bom:1.8.10

Initially I also had Firebase analytics 11.4.0 and Crashlytics 11.4.0 but I started a new project to test just the mediations. 
Is there a short fix for this? 
Thank you!

issue.title: iOS Test Device Identifiers Changing with every install

labels.name: Support
labels.description: General question, Installation question, or feedback.

issue.body:
<!-- DO NOT DELETE
validate_template=true
template_path=.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/bug_report.md
-->
### Step 0: Are you in the right place?

I tried this first.
    https://groups.google.com/g/google-admob-ads-sdk/c/U49xMrRt37o

### [REQUIRED] Step 1: Describe your environment

  * Unity version: **2022.3.5f1**
  * Google Mobile Ads Unity plugin version: **8.5.2**
  * Platform: **iOS** (iOS, Android, Unity Editor)
  * Platform OS version: **iPadOS 16.6.1 and iOS 16.6.1** (eg iOS 10, Android 9)
  * Any specific devices issue occurs on: **iPad Air 5th Generation and iPhone 13**
  * Mediation ad networks used, and their versions: none

### [REQUIRED] Step 2: Describe the problem

I integrated the Google Mobile Ads Unity Plugin v 8.5.2 into my Unity app on my Mac. In my AdMob account, I set the AdMob Privacy and messaging section with a GDPR message and an IDFA explainer.

I'm testing the ConsentDebugSettings in my Android devices and my iOS devices. I want to make sure the consent form appears. So I created a ConsentDebugSettings object with DebugGeography set to DebugGeography.EEA. I am passing the test device identifiers that appear in my iOS console and Android logcat console.

The Android devices return the same test device identifiers every time I build and install the app to test.

The iOS devices return a different test device identifier in the UMP SDK packet every time I build and install the app to test. It looks like a GUID, not a hashed value. For example, I'm getting UMP SDK test identifier values like FB8FFEB5-9595-44EE-BF54-08DF3AB368AF. That doesn't look like the hashed value I get from my Android devices. Nor does it looks like the test device identifier I get from the Google Mobile Ads console message, "To get test ads on this device, set test identifiers to [some hashed value]."

All of my devices are configured as test devices. And they have been used in another app that I have published. This is the first time I'm trying the EEA consent and IDFA explainer logic with the UMP.

Is this a bug in the UMP API for iOS?

On my iOS devices, I see the IDFA explainer every time I uninstall and reinstall the app. I do not see the consent form.

On the Android devices, I see the consent form. Of course, I do not see the IDFA explainer.

I am unable to test the consent form on iOS due to this issue. Any help would be appreciated.


#### Steps to reproduce:

What happened? How can we make the problem occur?

I have a simple Unity app, which uses my bundle identifier and my dev provisioning profile. It uses my app's AdMob AppID. You would have to change these to test it. I can send the code but you should be able to reproduce this in your own test environment.

This could be a description, log/console output, etc.

From my iPad Air device I see this console message, "<UMP SDK> To enable debug mode for this device, set: UMPDebugSettings.testDeviceIdentifiers = @[ @"3534D356-EF9F-4325-811E-AF18C5D6C352" ];".

From my iPhone device I see this message, "<UMP SDK> To enable debug mode for this device, set: UMPDebugSettings.testDeviceIdentifiers = @[ @"FB8FFEB5-9595-44EE-BF54-08DF3AB368AF" ];".

These change every time I reinstall the app.

Please share a downloadable sample project that reproduces the bug, if
available. This greatly helps us to diagnose and fix the issue faster.

#### Relevant Code:

```
// TODO(you): code here to reproduce the problem

var debugSettings = new ConsentDebugSettings
{
    DebugGeography = DebugGeography.EEA,
    TestDeviceHashedIds = new List<string> { "myAndroidIdsWork", "myIOSIdsKeepChanging" } 
};
ConsentRequestParameters request = new ConsentRequestParameters
{
    TagForUnderAgeOfConsent = false,
}
request.ConsentDebugSettings = debugSettings;
ConsentInformation.Update(request, OnConsentInfoUpdated);

```
This works in my Android devices. It doesn't work in my iOS devices.

issue.title: External Dependency Manager fails to resolve the MetaAudienceNetwork dependencies.
issue.body:
<!-- DO NOT DELETE
validate_template=true
template_path=.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/bug_report.md
-->
  * Unity version: 2022.3.10f1
  * Google Mobile Ads Unity plugin version: v8.5.2
  * Platform: UnityEditor Android build
  * Mediation ad networks used, and their versions: IronSource-2.3.1, UnityAds-3.8.0, AppLovin-6.9.1, MetaAudienceNetwork-3.11.0

Apparently when I add MetaAudienceNetwork-3.11.0 adapter External Dependency Manager fails to resolve.
Here is the console error message:
```
Resolution failed
Failed to fetch the following dependencies:
org.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-bom:1.8.10
```

#### Steps to reproduce:
Download the demo project
[https://drive.google.com/file/d/1raDeZt11w3lO7tl8L-OHIi1TWwYlfoUq](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1raDeZt11w3lO7tl8L-OHIi1TWwYlfoUq)
Try to resolve the dependencies:
Assets > External Dependency Resolver > Android Resolver > Force Resolve

comment.body:
@Raydekk 

You can also try updating to Unity `2022.3`.

> Is there a certain version that needs to be used here: com.google.android.gms:play-services-ads ?

The issue is specific to Android version `22.4.0`

The Google Mobile Ads Android SDK 22.4.0 added a [<property>](https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/manifest/property-element) element in its Android manifest. Building against this version or higher requires Android compile API level 33 or higher, Gradle 6.7.1 or higher, and [Android Gradle plugin](https://developer.android.com/reference/tools/gradle-api) 4.2.0 or higher.


We are looking into a better fix.

issue.title: I get a message in logcat about using deprecated sdk, but i used last version of admob unity plugin
issue.body:
<!-- DO NOT DELETE
validate_template=true
template_path=.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/bug_report.md
-->
  * Unity version: 2021.3.12
  * Google Mobile Ads Unity plugin version: 8.5.2
  * Platform: Android
  * Platform OS version: Android 8


I get this message after initialize in android logcat after running game in android device:

Received log message: <Google:HTML> You are currently using version 232400999.231700000.1 of the SDK, which is out of date. Please consider updating your SDK to the most recent SDK version to get the latest features and bug fixes. The latest SDK can be installed from https://googlemobileadssdk.page.link/android-install-instructions. More information about the SDK deprecation schedule is available at https://developers.google.com/admob/android/deprecation.

I used last unity plugin and i don't know why i get this message.

comment.body:
@omml Yes I mean the `GoogleMobileAdsDependencies.xml` file.

If you can share with me the version of the Android SDK you are using from this file as well as the exact error log I will take another look.
